'''Glirhuin''' was a [[Seers|seer]] and [[Minstrels|harp-player]] of the [[Haladin]] who lived in the Forest of [[Brethil]] during the [[First Age]].

Glirhuin composed a song that said that the [[Stone of the Hapless]] would never be defiled by [[Morgoth]] nor sink below the sea. Indeed after [[Beleriand]] fell beneath the waves, still [[Tol Morwen]] stood alone above the waters.<ref>{{S|Doriath}}</ref>

==Etymology==
The name is not glossed, but as Paul Strack notices, it contains the element ''glir-'' ("sing").<ref>{{webcite|author=Paul Strack|articleurl=http://eldamo.org/content/words/word-1947164253.html|articlename=S. ''Glirhuin'' m.|website=Eldamo|accessed=8 June 2021}}</ref>
